About Me

Welcome to my personal webpage. I am Tanuj Kulshrestha. Currently I am living in Berlin and working as a Data Engineer in Universal Music Group since July 2019. I am Data Enthusiast and love moving data.

I studied at [RWTH Aachen University](http://www.rwth-aachen.de/cms/~a/root/?lidx=1), Germany's largest and leading technical university. The [Computer Science](http://www.informatik.rwth-aachen.de/) I studied Software Systems Engineering and my main focus areas were Big Data, Data Modelling and RDBMS.

Currently, I am working at [Universal Music Group, Berlin](https://www.universal-music.de/) as a ***Data Engineer*** in the group. My responsibilities include moving data by creating data pipelines using Airflow, Python and Google Cloud Platform.

To know more about my personal life, please visit [this](http://tank113.github.io/personal_life/) page. To know about my academics, head to my [Academics](http://tank113.github.io/academic/) page.

Past Events:

  • 15.01.2018: I successfully passed the DSM exam, equivalent to Level B1 in German at the Sprachenzentrum RWTH Aachen
  • 01.01.2018: In January 2018, I joined AUDI AG for an Internship as a Data Scientist.
  • 20.10.2017: I performed at the Diwali festival celebration in Aachen, organised by AISA (Association of Indian Students in Aachen)
  • 07.07.2017: I delivered a talk on Automatic Raga Recognition in Hindustani Classical Music for my seminar on Computer Music. The slides can be found here. Along with that, there is also an accompanying academic paper, which can be found here.
  • 25.04.2017: I took two seminars, namely Privacy and Big Data and Computer Music and a lab course on SMT-Solving with Simplex
  • 15.04.2017: I started my the second semester of my Master studies. In this semester, I am taking courses on Logic Programming, Software Project Management and Functional Safety and System Dependability
  • 10.03.2017: I came to the end of the first phase of my exam season. I took exams in 5 subjects, namely Satisfiability Checking, Computer Vision, Virtual Reality, Big Data in Medical Informatics and Implementation of Databases.
  • 20.03.2017: I successfully completed Level A2 in German at the Sprachenzentrum RWTH Aachen
  • 01.04.2017: I took a break to visit India for 20 days
  • 20.12.2016: I travelled to the San Francisco Bay Area to visit my lovely cousins for the Christmas Break!
  • 22.11.2016: I helped as a volunteer to organize the Tag Der Informatik (Computer Science Day) at RWTH
  • 16.10.2016: I continued job as a Research Assistant at the Databases and Information Systems Group under PD Dr. Christoph Quix
  • 05.10.2016: I delivered a talk at i5 on Machine Learning Methods. Slides are available here
  • 01.10.2016: I successfully completed Level A1 in German at the Sprachenzentrum RWTH Aachen
